In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Julia code for a function that iterates over words and adds new lines when the text width exceeds a maximum value:
```julia-repl
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    # Initialize an empty string to store the wrapped text
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    current_line = 1
    
    for word in split(text)
        if length(word) + length(wrapped_text) > text_width
            # Add a new line and reset the current line counter
            wrapped_text *= "\n"
            current_line += 1
            
            # Append the word to the wrapped text
            wrapped_text *= word * " "
        else
            # Append the word to the wrapped text
            wrapped_text *= word * " "
        end
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end
```
Example usage:
```julia-repl
# Set a maximum text width of 15 characters (default is 10)
wrap_string("This is an example sentence.", 15)

# Output:
"This is an\nexample\nsentence. "
```
In this example, the function adds a new line whenever the total character count for the current line exceeds the maximum text width of 15 characters. You can change the maximum text width to whatever value you need.
